Tragic Katie Rough was bridesmaid at parents' wedding just weeks before her death A 15-year-old girl has been charged with murder after seven-year-old Katie died in York on Monday Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Emotional tribute left for Katie Rough after her murder in York Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Tragic Katie Rough was a bridesmaid at her parents' wedding just two weeks before her death. 
The seven-year-old stole the show in a pretty silver sequined dress as she proudly stood with mum Alison and dad Paul. 
Just a fortnight later, Katie died after her throat was slashed in playing fields. 
Desperate mum Alison raced to the scene crying: “No, no, it’s my little girl.” Read More Katie was a bridesmaid at her parents' wedding just two weeks ago (Photo: Facebook) Katie was found with her throat slashed (Photo: Internet Unknown) 
A 15-year-old girl has now been charged with murder, police confirmed. 
She is also charged with the possession of an offensive weapon, North Yorkshire Police said. 
The girl will appear at York Magistrates Court on Wednesday morning. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Latest update on seven-year-old girl found dying in York Share this video Watch Next Katie poses for a picture with a kitten. She was described as a "princess" by her grandparents (Photo: FACEBOOK) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Girl found in York with serious injuries dies Share this video Watch Next 
Katie was stabbed on Monday afternoon an hour after school finished. 
The little girl’s mum was alerted to the horror and raced to the scene in a car. But after seeing her wounded child, s he dropped to her knees sobbing: “No, no , it’s my little girl. Help get an ambulance.” 
Katie died after the attack which took place around 4.30pm. 
Her dad Paul Rough arrived at the fields in the affluent Woodthorpe area of York, North Yorks, shortly after his wife, Alison, 38. 
The attack took place just over half a mile from the Rough’s home in Foxwood, York. 
As medics worked on their daughter, the distraught mum paced back and forwards from the field where her daughter lay stricken in the mud while the dad stood slumped against a wall in despair. 
The couple, who married two weeks ago, comforted each other as she was stretchered away with an oxygen mask on. Read More Katie is pictured here with her mum Alison and brother Kieran (Photo: FACEBOOK) An aerial view of the crime scene where forensics are currently looking for evidence (Photo: SWNS) 
Katie was declared dead at hospital. 
It is believed the horror was witnessed by several locals walking their dogs. 
They are thought to have alerted police and paramedics to the horror after seeing a wound to Katie’s neck. 
Consultant engineer Rob McCartney, 50, said he went to see what was happening after seeing “shadows” moving around outside. 
“As I opened the door the girl’s mother was running into the street shouting ‘Get an ambulance’. I asked if she was all right and she said: 
“No, no, she’s my little girl,” he said. 
“I put on my shoes and went down the alley which runs along the side of my house and I could see a young girl lying on the playing field behind where we live. 
“She was face down but on her side. I think I could see she was wearing boots.” Tragic Katie with her parents, Alison and Paul (Photo: FACEBOOK) 
At that point there were already two police officers attending to her. 
“I turned around and saw the mother was in a state of great distress, crying and shouting out for her daughter, it was very upsetting to see her. 
“She was moving back and forth between the playing field and the street and was crying out “she’s killed her, she’s killed her.” 
“A few minutes later the girl was wheeled down the alleyway on a gurney trolley with an oxygen mask over her face. She was wheeled to an ambulance and it set off with its blue lights flashing. 
“I thought ‘she’d be OK, she’d go to hospital and she’d be fine’. To wake up and hear she had died this morning was terrible.” Katie was founded wounded in a field and died a short time later (Photo: North Yorkshire Police) Paul and Alison Rough (Photo: Ben Lack Photography Ltd) 
The couple who are said to have been together for years. 
A shocked relative told how the rest of the family were “all together” adding: “We can’t get our heads around it. She was a bonny little lass.” 
A good pal and work colleague of Katie’s 34-year-old dad Paul, said: “They are the last people in the world you would think something like this would happen to. “It’s torn them apart and will do forever. It’s absolutely appalling.” 
The girl’s grandparents arrived in the afternoon to lay flowers at the scene. It said: “Night night my darling princess Katie. Love Nana and Grandad xx xx” Read More A forensic tent was put up last night and remains there today (Photo: SWNS) The "full circumstances" of the girls' death are still unknown (Photo: SWNS) Police taped over the number plate of a black Peugeot 206 car (Photo: Glen Minikin) 
The grandparents, aged in their 60s, walked into the cul-de-sac on foot. 
It is believed Alison had three grown-up children from a previous marriage. 
Tearful mums brought their children to lay flowers at the scene, where a forensic tent was put up on the edge of the field near an alleyway. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
